instrupy.base.Instrument¶

class instrupy.base.Instrument(_type=None, name=None, mode=None, _id=None)[source]¶

Main class used to initialize instruments with consideration of multiple operating modes. Each operating mode is stored as a of the type of the respective instrument-model class in a variable length list.

Variables

  • _type (str) – Type of instrument.

  • name (str) – Name of instrument.

  • mode (list, instrupy.basic_sensor_model (or) instrupy.passive_optical_scanner_model (or) instrupy.synthetic_aperture_radar_model) – List of the objects of types corresponding to the instrument type. Each object stores the corresponding mode specifications.

  • mode_id (list, str) – List of identifiers of the instrument modes. Note the order of the ids in the list is synced to the order of the modes in mode instance variable list.

  • _id (str) – Instrument identifier.

Usage:

x = Instrument.from_dict(specs) 
mode1_fov = x.get_fov(mode=1) 
metrics = x.calc_data_metrics(mode=4)
obsv1 = x.synthesize_observations(2459266.6, [{...},{...},{...},.....,{...}], 4)
